common.phaseBannerHTML: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

applyCitesPermit.pageBody1: Use this service to apply for a permit to import, export or re-export under the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES).
applyCitesPermit.pageBody2: You can use this service to apply for a permit to:
applyCitesPermit.bullet1: import, export or re-export a specimen
applyCitesPermit.bullet2: use a specimen for commercial purposes (also called an Article 10)

permitType.defaultTitle: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.pageHeader: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.radioOptionImportHint: To move a species into Great Britain from another country.
permitType.radioOptionExportHint: To move a species out of Great Britain to another country.
permitType.radioOptionReexportHint: To move a species that has already been imported into Great Britain to another country.
permitType.radioOptionArticle10Hint: To use any CITES annex A specimen for commercial purposes.

errorMessages.error.permitType.any.required: Select the type of permit or certificate that you are applying for
errorMessages.error.permitType.any.only: Select the type of permit or certificate that you are applying for

cannotUseService.pageTitle: You cannot use this service yet
cannotUseService.pageHeader: You cannot use this service yet
cannotUseService.pageBody: You can only use this service to apply for:
cannotUseService.link: Check how to apply for other CITES permits and certificates

applyingOnBehalf.defaultTitle: Are you applying on behalf of someone else?
applyingOnBehalf.pageHeader: Are you applying on behalf of someone else?
applyingOnBehalf.pageBody1: Select ‘yes’ if you are completing this application:

bulletListItems.bulletListItem: for a friend or family member

applyingOnBehalf.pageBody2: Select ‘no’ if you are completing this application on behalf of yourself, your business or the business that you work for.

speciesName.defaultTitle: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.pageHeader: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.bodyText: Enter the exact scientific name as it appears on the CITES species list. You can
speciesName.bodyLinkText: search for the scientific name on species+
speciesName.bodyText2: (opens in new tab), then copy and paste it below.

couldNotConfirm.pageTitle: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.pageHeader: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.bodyText1: We could not confirm the scientific name ‘
couldNotConfirm.bodyText2: ’ on the species list. You can
couldNotConfirm.linkText: check scientific names on species+ (opens in a new tab)

animal.radioOptionRHint: Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
animal.radioOptionDHint: Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
animal.radioOptionCHint: Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)
animal.radioOptionFHint: Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)

purposeCode.radioOptionBHint: Breeding in captivity or artificial propagation

specimenType.radioOptionAnimalWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantProductHint: Any plant body or part that was removed from its natural habitat to make a product. For example, seeds, fruits, roots, stems, flowers or leaves, including extracts or powders.
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorkedHint: A specimen that has been significantly altered from its natural raw state and used for items such as furniture, jewellery, carved figures or musical instruments.

uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody1: You should add any documents that may support your application. For example, you can upload:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: an Article 10 certificate for the specimen’s parents
proof of ownership or how you acquired the specimen

uploadSupportingDocuments.agentBulletListItem: permission to act on the applicant’s behalf
uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody2: You can upload a total of 10 files. Files must be smaller than 10MB and either:
uploadSupportingDocuments.spanNoFilesUploaded: You have not uploaded any files
